creator: tim.elcott@gmail.com
text:
Within a test plan, if a Port Number is set within a the HTTP Request Defaults
all subsequent https requests (using HTTP Request) fail unless request port is
over-ridden to 443.

This behaviour is a regression from JMeter 2.2 where https would seem to
automatically over-ride the default port number.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
However in JMeter 2.2, if the defaults are:

http 8080

Then a request using https (no port) will use port 8080, which seems equally 
wrong.

The current behaviour is at least consistent - the port is derived from either 
the sampler or the http defaults element - whereas previously the http 
defaults port was ignored if it was 80 (and only 80).

For consistency, JMeter 2.2 and earlier should have ignored the default port 
443 if the protocol was http, but it did not.

So I think the current behaviour is better.

The documentation does need to be clarified however.

In addition, in JMeter 2.2, if the defaults were set to

https   80

then the port number was completely ignored even for https requests, which is 
unexpected behaviour.

I've updated the documentation to clarify the behaviour.

Thanks for reporting the issue.
creator: sebb@apache.org
